thread.title: The Regulating of ‘Love’ Is A Massive FDA Power Grab

author: wsjcom
title: The Regulating of ‘Love’ Is A Massive FDA Power Grab
text: Regarding Sheldon Bradshaw and Marisa Maleck’s “The Twisted Case of the ‘Deceptive’ Pretzels” (op-ed, April 2): The article underestimates the value of the work provided by the Food and Drug Administration. Despite the regulation of the local, family-owned Nashoba Brook Bakery in Concord by almost 10 government agencies, it took the FDA to sanction it for actively deceiving its customers into thinking that “love” was an ingredient in its granola. Fortunately, following the FDA’s warning letter, the practice ended. Now, we only need to ensure that the love formerly in the granola mix isn’t a carcinogen. Perhaps an enterprising...
